arch:Archive.foaf:name: Museum of History & Industry, Sophie Frye Bass Library
arch:Archive.nwda:visitation: The Sophie Frye Bass Library is located in the MOHAI Resource Center in the Georgetown neighborhood of Seattle. The address is 5933 6th Avenue South. The library's hours are 1-4 pm Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Fridays by appointment.
arch:Archive.nwda:facsimile: The Sophie Frye Bass Library provides reproductions of photographs and other items in our collections. Go to http://www.mohai.org/research/photo-price-list for information on terms of use, use fees, and reproduction prices. Use the order form at http://www.mohai.org/research/photo-archive-order-form to place an order.
arch:Archive.dcterms:description: The Sophie Frye Bass Library preserves and provides access to nearly 4 million historic photographs, as well as manuscripts and archives, maps, books, posters, motion pictures and printed ephemera. Our collections cover the Seattle metropolitan area, and certain subjects of the rest of Washington State and Alaska. Archival holdings include business and organization records, personal papers, photographers' collections, and historical research documents.
